page.title: 12The Hundleby Post Office.
page.content: Mrs.M. has been postmistress of the Hundleby Post Office for the last l8 months. She told us how the post office had origonally been two semi_ detatched houses over l50 years old. Then the dividing wall had been knocked down to make a space large enough for an office. Like most village post offices this is also a general store and sells everything from baby's dummies to washing_up bowls. Apart from selling stamps and mailing parcels, the office distributes senior citizen's pensions and funds for handicapped persons. Mr.M. does not work in the post office very much. He spends most of his time as a handyman around the village.
